column4: hello, i'm trying to play enemy territory on ubuntu 6.10 i386, i have installed the game and i have tried to start the game, but it only manages to set screen resolution to very low, then fails with: "GLimp_Init() - could not load OpenGL" all i have found using google was a german site and i don't speak german :-(
what graphics card drivers are you using?
cut and paste that to a terminal
nvidia-glx is already the newest version.
$ sudo /usr/sbin/nvidia-glx-config enable says "Error: unable to load nvidia kernel driver! Be sure to have installed the nvidia driver for your running kernel." but i have installed nvidia-glx...
thanks, but i get "E: Couldn't find package kernel-headers-2.6.17-10-generic"
ah, they might still be called linux-headers for you. :) running dapper?
runnning "sudo apt-get install linux-headers-`uname -r`" outputs "linux-headers-2.6.17-10-generic is already the newest version."
did you run nvidia-glx-config as i asked you? did you restart x?
yes but it failed to start
